text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm with CodeRed cheese spread that's
right i'm gonna show you how to make
this dangerously spicy party snack for
two very good reasons first it's easy to
make and tastes amazing but second and
much more importantly i was tagged by
andrew benji with babish to participate
in his hot pepper challenge for ALS
although unlike him i'm not gonna be
able to eat a habanero and ghost pepper
live on camera don't worry I have a
doctor's note but anyway we're still
gonna hopefully raise some funds with
this spread and I will give you more
info as we proceed but for now let's
just go ahead and get started with the
base of this spread which is a lot of
cream cheese and for me three different
kinds okay the first would be a very
creamy French cream cheese called
fromage blanc I also have some fairly
fancy cream cheese which is sort of
drying crumbly and then my third variety
would be your basic standard comes in a
square or rectangular foil package cream
cheese from a certain East Coast City
where people like to say yo and even
though I'm using an array of different
cream cheeses you could do this with any
one of them or any combination as long
as you have about two pounds total
and then to that for a little bit of
acidity we will add a small splash of
apple cider vinegar or the vinegar of
your choice we will also add a little
touch of tomato paste for both acidity
and color
we will also splash in a little bit of
Worcestershire sauce as well as some
onion and garlic powder not to be
confused with onion salt and garlic salt
this is just pure dried powdered onion
and garlic and that's going to conclude
the non pepper portion of this program
and before we get to our dried peppers
we will add some wet in the form of
sriracha which is never not beautiful
and yes that is a lot but not too much
and then next up we're going to add the
first of our two kinds of pepper Rica
this being what we call in the business
sweet paprika which simply means it's
not spicy and then we're also gonna add
in a whole bunch of smoked paprika which
comes both mild and spicy and I'm
definitely using a spicy one here and
not only does that add heat but also a
beautiful smokiness which is why I like
to refer to that as the bacon of spices
but anyway we'll continue on with some
Chipotle which is also a little smoky
and very spicy and then last but never
least we will add a nice big spoon of
cayenne and that's going to be it for
now at this point we'll take a sturdy
wooden spoon and mix this thoroughly and
thoughtfully until it's fully combined
and we cannot see any streaks of cream
cheese and by the way as usual I will
include all these amounts in the blog
post but if there was ever a time you
were gonna adjust things to your tastes
this would be one of them all right I'm
intentionally making this painfully
spicy but you may not want yours that
hot or you may want to push it even
further risking possible legal action by
one of your guests who knows so please
feel free to adjust all these amounts to
your liking you are after all the judge
dredd of this fundraising spread but
anyway we will go ahead and mix that
very very very well and once mixed it is
theoretically ready to serve but I do
not recommend it okay I don't know that
much about the laws of the universe but
I do know this what things want to get
dry and dry things want to get wet so
what I'm gonna do once this is mixed and
I've cleaned up that bowl with a spatula
is I'm gonna wrap it up and pop it in
the fridge overnight or at the very
least for a few hours and that's gonna
give it time for all those dried chili
peppers to rehydrate and fully develop
all those beautiful flavors and yes of
course you could taste it at this point
and I did and it was delicious and
incredibly spicy but I'm gonna do my
final seasoning and adjustments the next
day so I wrap that up and popped it in
the fridge and then the next morning
pulled it out and unwrapped it and gave
it a taste to evaluate and I think we
should do that twice once playing just
off our finger to taste it as is and
then a second time on whatever we're
gonna serve this with which for me are
these long thin fancy flat breads which
by the way we could make ourselves but
won't so he gave that a taste and found
it to be absolutely delicious
and incredibly spicy but decided it did
need a touch of salt as well as I
decided to make it even spicier mostly
because I found an old bottle of ghost
pepper sauce in the back of my fridge
it's
this is a hot pepper challenge after all
I decided to splash in a stupid amount
of that and I gave this a final mix and
yes I do feel a little bit bad I'm not
gonna chomp through like three ghost
peppers on camera but as you know I
don't show myself and also my medical
team advised against it they said it's
okay to kill myself with food but they
recommend I do it gradually over a long
period of time but anyway I mixed that
in and gave it a final taste and deemed
it painfully perfect and once we're
happy with that we'll go ahead and
transfer it into a serving bowl and add
some kind of decorative swirls on top as
well as one last shake of cayenne just
to stay in shape and that's it what I'm
calling CodeRed cheese spread is done
and then to warn my guests that this
really is truly a Code Red
possibly dangerous spread I surrounded
the bowl with some red warning lights
although they only look good with the
shade Ron and it would have been too
dark to film me tasting this so I raised
the shade and took them away plus they
did look sort of dumb but anyway I went
in for the official taste and while
relatively painful to eat it's also
incredibly tasty and absolutely
addictive okay if you've done this
properly your guests will complain this
is too hot but they won't be able to
stop eating it alright that is the ideal
scenario and because we've used a cream
cheese base and dairy tends to cool the
burn when you take a bite it starts off
slowly and then builds and builds until
you think it's too hot and then right
before you start to panic it fades and
to me that's really the magic behind
this recipe plus as far as making a
homemade party snack it doesn't get much
easier than this so I do hope you try
this out which reminds me I have to tag
three others for the hot pepper
challenge which will be the entire crew
from everyday food yes all of them Sarah
Thomas Shira and Lindsay as well as
Hilah from Hilah cooking since she made
me do a podcast and then my third
challenge goes to Byron Talbott because
he seems so cool I want to see if he
actually sweats so that's who I'm
tagging for the hot pepper challenge for
ALS and hopefully they'll join in along
with all of you of course to help raise
a little bit of money for this very
worthy cause
so thank you to Andrew for this
challenge and I will add all the links
and pertinent info in the description
and above and beyond all that I really
do hope you give this code red cheese
spread a try soon so head over to food
wishes comm for all the ingredient
amounts of more info as usual and as
always enjoy
[Music]
